frontmatter.title: 365 days of drawing faces
frontmatter.excerpt: Year one of my 365 day portrait project may be over, but I'm just getting started.

markdownRemark.html:
Today my 365 project titled PaperFaces turns one â€” holy smokes! In this past year Iâ€™ve managed to illustrate 476 portraits, make a ton of new Paper friends, burned through a few pen styli, and rekindled my passion for drawing.

I honestly canâ€™t believe Iâ€™ve been drawing strangers for 365 days straight. I was half joking when I posted this and had no idea it would take off in the way that it did.

Retweet and I'll draw your profile picture using Paper on my iPad #MadeWithPaper pic.twitter.com/5oqH4bJt

— ğ”ğ”¦ğ” ğ”¥ğ”ğ”¢ğ”© â„œğ”¬ğ”°ğ”¢ (@mmistakes) August 29, 2012

Big ups and stuff

  • Thank you to everyone who volunteered their face for the project.
  • Thank you to the 91 of you who commissioned portraits.
  • Thank you to everyone who has followed me on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.
  • Thank you for all the kind @replies, emails, comments, favorites, likes, and encouragement.
  • Thank you FiftyThree for developing the app that made all this possible, fostering a community of creators who inspire me daily, and for supporting my project by featuring it in posts and tweets.

Hereâ€™s to another fun year of blank faces. And to the thousands of you still waiting for portraitsâ€¦ Iâ€™m working on them, really I am.
